summary: Completed testing of Experiments Lab Flow with HTTPS Fix. Successfully identified and partially resolved mixed content security issues. Backend APIs working perfectly (13/14 tests passed). Frontend experiments functionality significantly improved - experiments list and creation now working with HTTPS, but experiment detail pages still affected by server redirect issues.

minor_bugs.issue: Invalid SMILES returns 520 instead of expected 400 status code
minor_bugs.impact: Minor - error handling works but status code inconsistent

critical_bugs.issue: Server redirect chain causing mixed content security errors for experiment detail endpoints
critical_bugs.impact: Prevents experiment detail pages and generation from working properly
critical_bugs.error_details: Server redirects HTTPS requests to HTTP for URLs like /api/experiments/{id} and /api/experiments/{id}/runs, causing mixed content security blocks
critical_bugs.root_cause: Server configuration issue - HTTPS requests are being redirected to HTTP (307 redirect from port 443 to 80)

resolved_issues.issue: Mixed content security error for basic experiments endpoints
resolved_issues.resolution: Fixed by updating getApiUrl() function to add trailing slashes and ensuring all components use getApiUrl() instead of direct environment variables

minor_warnings.issue: Console warning about undefined jsmeOnLoad function
minor_warnings.impact: No functional impact - just console noise

passed_tests: HTTPS requests for basic experiments endpoints

success_percentage.integration: 60% (basic experiments working, detail pages blocked by server redirects)

action_item_for_main_agent: Fix server configuration to prevent HTTPS to HTTP redirects. The server is redirecting HTTPS requests to HTTP for experiment detail endpoints (URLs with IDs), causing mixed content security errors. This is a server/infrastructure configuration issue, not a frontend code issue. The redirect chain is: HTTPS /api/experiments/{id} → 307 redirect to HTTP → 301 redirect back to HTTPS.
